coursetitle: Gross Anatomy of the Limbs and Cavities

topics: Birth: Fetal period, Fetal Membrane, Placenta

aim: The course aims to provide an understanding of the molecular organization of the cell, including its types, diversity, and organelles. It also covers the chemical composition of cells and the role of biomolecules.
topics: Hierarchy of molecular organization of the cell
Cell organelles of prokaryotes and eukaryotes
Structure, function, and fraction of extracellular organelles
Water and biomolecules: proteins, carbohydrates, lipids, DNA, etc.
Concepts of African cultures and civilization

aim: The course aims to sensitize non-philosophy and non-humanities students to the relevance of philosophy and logical thinking.
topics: Meaning and significance of philosophy to human existence
Search for meaning and value in the universe
Introduction to critical thinking in human endeavors

aim: The course aims to introduce students to various aspects of the English language and literature, including essay writing, formal letter writing, punctuation, pronunciation, literary analysis, and poetry.
topics: Introduction to Literary Studies: Subgenres and elements
Prose fiction: A literary study of Chinua Achebe's Things Fall Apart
Drama: A literary study of Keye Abiona's Even Kins Are Guilty: A Traditional Play
Poetry: A literary study of selected anthology of poems

coursetitle: Introduction to Foods and Nutrition II
aim: This course aims to provide foundational knowledge of basic concepts in food and nutrition, with a secondary objective of understanding the consequences of undernutrition, hidden hunger, and overnutrition.
topics: Energy Production and Metabolism in Humans
Balance, Weight Control and Physical Fitness

aim: The course aims to introduce learners to the basic knowledge of physics required in clinical science fields such as physiotherapy, medical laboratory science, and biochemistry, focusing on the application of physics to biological systems.
topics: Kinematics and the Algebra of Vectors
First, Second, and Third Laws of Motion by Isaac Newton and Their Applications
Elastic Property of Materials and Strength of Materials
Momentum and Its Application to Concussion, Fracture, and Similar Medical Situations during Collision
Energy Conservation and Thermodynamics and Their Applications to Metabolism in the Body System
Application of Angular Momentum, Harmonic Motion, and Diffusion to Osmotic Pressure and Movement of Substances in the Body System
Motion of Gas Molecules, Intermolecular Collision, Distribution Function, and Transport Processes in the Body
Statics: Forces Acting on a Human Body
Momentum Conservation; Application to Concussion and Fracture during Impacts, and to Similar Medical Situations
Conservation of Energy; The First Law of Thermodynamics; Applications to Metabolism and Work Done by Various Organs of the Body
Harmonic Motion and Diffusion; Application to Osmotic Pressure and Passage of Substances through Capillary Walls
Molecular Motion in Gases: Distribution Functions and the Boltzmann Principles
Equilibrium in External Fields; The Centrifuge and Measurement of Molecular Weight
aim: The course aims to provide elementary knowledge of physics to biology students.
The course covers various aspects of human physiology.
This course covers the physiology of the Nervous System.
This course provides an introduction to various psychological disorders and psychopathologies, both globally and within the context of Nigerian society.

topics: Calculating Energy Requirement and Content of Commonly-Consumed Nigerian Foods
Digestion and Metabolism of Carbohydrates, Proteins & Fats/Oils
aim: This course aims to provide foundational knowledge of basic concepts in food and nutrition. It also aims to guide students on cultivating healthy eating habits.

topics: Scope for Statistical Methods in Biology, Agriculture, Physical Sciences, and Engineering
Measures of Location, Partition, and Dispersion
Introduction to Combinatorics, Densities, and Distributions
Chebyshev's Inequalities and Law of Large Numbers
Exploratory Data Analysis, Simple Linear Regression, and Correlation
aim: This course aims to provide students with a foundation in statistical methods applicable to various fields such as biology, agriculture, physical sciences, and engineering.
